title: Variables
summary: Variables are containers for storing data values. In Python, a variable is created the moment you first assign a value to it. They allow you to label data with a descriptive name, making your programs more understandable to the reader and yourself. Think of them like labeled boxes where you can store information to use later.
sample_question: Can you explain what a variable is in your own words and give an example of how you might use one?

title: Loops
summary: Loops are used to repeat a block of code. For example, a 'for' loop is used for iterating over a sequence (that is either a list, a tuple, a dictionary, a set, or a string). A 'while' loop we can execute a set of statements as long as a condition is true. They save you from writing the same code over and over again.
sample_question: What is the main difference between a for loop and a while loop?

title: Functions
summary: A function is a block of code which only runs when it is called. You can pass data, known as parameters, into a function. A function can return data as a result. Functions help break our program into smaller and modular chunks. As our program grows larger and larger, functions make it more organized and manageable.
